channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: Ruby and Its Neighbors: Smalltalk
item.description:
The major player was ParcPlace, which was a spinoff of Xerox that provided Smalltalk tools. I taught an undergrad OO class in Smalltalk in 1997 and 1998 to students that wanted to be learning C++, and I remember telling them that Smalltalk programmers were paid more. Your main interfaces to the smalltalk system are a.

Read more

item.title: Norway reviews cybersecurity after remote-access feature found in Chinese buses
item.description:
A Yutong electric bus in Norway. Authorities are tightening cybersecurity controls after hidden SIM cards were discovered during internal tests. Norway has launched a cybersecurity review after public transport operator Ruter discovered that electric buses supplied by Chinese manufacturer Yutong contained hidden SIM cards enabling potential remote access.

Read more

item.title: Ask HN: My family business runs on a 1993-era text-based-UI (TUI). Anybody else?
item.description:
Is anybody still using TUI applications for business. I had a blast and still love this application. This got me thinking: Are other companies still using this type of interface to drive their core operations.

Read more

item.title: Microsoft Can't Keep EU Data Safe from US Authorities
item.description:
However, the admission raises serious concerns around European data sovereignty. Senate members said they couldn't be sure that the two platforms were sufficiently separated, and that sensitive health data wouldn't be shared.
